text.front:
FUNDAMENTAL AND APPLIED TOXICOLOGY 9, 595-597 (1987)
SHORT COMMUNICATION
Effect of Fusarochromanone and T-2 Toxin on Articular
Chondrocytes in Monolayer Culture
Effect of Fusarochromanone and T-2 Toxin on Articular Chondrocytes in Monolayer Cul-
ture. WRIGHT, G. C, JR., MARASAS. W. F. O., AND SOKOLOFF, L. (1987). Fundam. Appl. Toxi-
col. 9, 595-597.
The effect of fusarochromanone and T-2 toxin on DNA synthesis and radio-
sulfate incorporation by rabbit articular chondrocytes was studied in monolayer culture. T-2
toxin reduced DNA more than 50% at 5 X 10~9 M; fusarochromanone caused small but progres-
sive decrements over a range of 5 X 10~8 to 10~6 M. These actions are not specific for chondro-
cytes. The findings lend no support to the hypothesis that fusarochroraanone, at least in unmodi-
fied form, is the etiologic agent in Kashin-Beck disease.
